title: Macbook Pro A1398(820-3787-A) Backlight problem
message:
i changed the J8300 because there is short in all 5 capacitors C8300 and C7717/18/19/16
I Put Connector from A1466
but the short in the capacitors gone but the backlight problem not gone.
i made my measurements for Voltage on F7700  12 volt -- Q7706 (pin 3 LCDBKLT_EN_L11.7 volt -pin 4  12 v --pin 5,6  changed from 9.6 -7v-5-v-to 2-volt and also on D7701 the same . PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT  0volt---PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD_UF    5volt
on Q7706  pin 1234  0volt but pin 5 go down fom 9 to 2 volt also
on U7750
Pin 2 BKLT_SCL_R 4.7 volt ---- Pin 4  5volt---Pin 5 BKL_1_SDA 3.2 Volt---Pin 6 BKL1_SCL 3.2 volt---Pin 7 2.4 volt--Pin 8  0.4 volt  Pin 11 5volt  Pin 10  0 volt

on U7701
Pin 2 -0volt , pin 5 -5volt , pin 9 -12.6 volt , pin 11-11volt , pin15 -4.7 volt , pin 16 4,7 volt ,pin 18 -  5 volt , pin 17  - 0 volt.
all the measurements without screen
if the problem from q7706-- can i use one from A1466

title: Macbook Pro A1398(820-3787-A) Backlight problem
message:
Do you get image at least?
Did you check for external video and USB activity?

title: Macbook Pro A1398(820-3787-A) Backlight problem
message:
i have image 
and work with external video and usb activity ok

title: Macbook Pro A1398(820-3787-A) Backlight problem
message: any idea to repair this problem??

title: Macbook Pro A1398(820-3787-A) Backlight problem
message:
"on Q7706  pin 1234  0volt but pin 5 go down fom 9 to 2 volt also"
As per schematics, pins 1, 2, [B][U]5[/U][/B], 6 are tied together.
However, irrelevant measurments, as pin 3 doesn't go low.
BKLT_SD opens Q7706, when goes to 0V.

Do you get LCD_BKLT_EN?

title: Macbook Pro A1398(820-3787-A) Backlight problem
message:
11.7V at LCD_BKLT_EN (R7742)???
Are you really sure?
Please, check schematic and post usefull information.

title: Macbook Pro A1398(820-3787-A) Backlight problem
message:
update
LCD_BKLT_EN -- 0volt without screen
                             3.3 volt with screen 

PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT -- 52 volt
PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD_UF--5 volt
until now there is no backlight on the screen just the image without light.
Pram reset done --but not solve the problem.
there is usb activity in the board

title: Macbook Pro A1398(820-3787-A) Backlight problem
message:
"PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT -- 52 volt"
Open LED strip.
Check LCD connector, video cable and LCD display.

Test full COMPATIBLE LCD assembly first.

title: Macbook Pro A1398(820-3787-A) Backlight problem
message: how can i check and what do u mean by open led strip

title: Macbook Pro A1398(820-3787-A) Backlight problem
message: LED strip from display is bad, or not good contacts to MLB.

title: Macbook Pro A1398(820-3787-A) Backlight problem
message:
update
test with new lcd from the same model and nothing changed
i change also j8300 and the same problem ( J8300 compatible with A1466)--(is it ok??) 
i have these voltage
LCD_BKLT_EN -- 0volt without screen
3.3 volt with screen

PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT -- 52 volt
PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD_UF--5 volt

until now there is no backlight on the screen just the image without light.
Pram reset done --but not solve the problem.
there is usb activity in the board

any help ?

title: Macbook Pro A1398(820-3787-A) Backlight problem
message:
"PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT -- 52 volt"
LED strip is open circuit!!!
Normal voltage is 40V aprox...

Did you check voltage direct on J8300?
Clean internal contacts.
Get another new connector.

title: Macbook Pro A1398(820-3787-A) Backlight problem
message:
direct also 52 volt
my question about the j8300 connector
i use one from a1466 -is it the same connector?
what about important signal to the screen need to measure also?

title: Macbook Pro A1398(820-3787-A) Backlight problem
message:
Both connectors have 30 pins, be sure to get good contacts inside.
If you get 52V at backlight rail, then the screen is correctly recognized; no need to check other pin voltage.
There should be image already.
